product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: Meh. The packaging is gorgeous and has weight to it, but as for the blush its nothing really specialty me. Due the color and my skin tone (medium skin tone) I had to layer it which wasn't an issue until I noticed how dry it looked from layering so much. The color itself is very pretty, but unfortunately it didn't amaze me.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: BEAUTIFUL PEACHY NUDE ON BROWN SKINTONE
review_content:
This is suchhhh a beautiful blush , I picked up the shades shes sincere and shes seductive and they work sooo well with my medium dark / indian olive skin tone ! The shade sincere looks like a nudey peachy shade on my skin and pairs well with anyyy eye look but also looks great without any makeup. I was rrly scared to try out this shade in particular because of all the reviews of it not swatching properly on darker skin tones but that’s not true! On my hands it doesn’t swatch as pigmented but on my face it looks sooo stunning. If you do have brown skin tone and you’re looking for a peachy blush , definitely check this out !

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: The perfect blush!!! I’m not a big blush person, and this was just what I wanted. It’s not very pigmented, so just a swirl and I’m good. It gives me some color and just looks nice and natural. I have light skin, so I think for darker skin it might not show up well. It is a sheer, light blush. I’m going to try the peach one next.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I got this blush in the shade "she's adorable" as the color looked so unique and would make the perfect summer blush. When I tried the product, it took about 4 dips in the pan to see a difference on my face, and by then my cheek just had a film of ashy-looking shimmer, and no color. I really wanted the color of this blush to come through, however it did not. One amazing thing about this product is that it has 10.5 grams of product, and blushes tend to have 5 to 6 grams of product, so having to dip in many times is not a deal-breaker. It came down to the lack of pigment, and abundance of shimmer that ruined the product.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Age 13-17', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
This is an absolutely lovely blush! The compact has weight to it, adding to its luxurious rose gold, mirrored design. The product has minimal fallout within the pan, and deposits enough onto the brush for a light dusting of colour. the pigmentation is not bright which is ideal for such a light, peachy nude shade. The price point for this blush is wonderful considering there is 10.5g of product for $40, while NARS blushes have 4.8g for $39.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush

review_content: This blush was okay, nothing particularly stands out. At the end of the day, it became dry on the skin, so it makes my skin a little flaky. There are better blushes out there.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I wish I had read and watched more reviews before purchasing, so unfortunately I was not expecting this to be sheer. I don't generally mind sheer blush, but this is way to sheer for me. It could possibly be the shade I chose, so I might try She's Seductive. But I could not build this up to be visible at all on my skin. So disappointed because I had such high hopes for this!

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I knew when I bought these from reading and watching reviews that these were going to be sheer, I just didn't realize that they would be this sheer. I love a blush that is more of a buildable formula since it's easier then to control how much you put on, but these are bordering on being a bit too sheer. I will say though that once built up on the cheeks this color is beautiful and they never look powdery or cakey even though it takes a lot of building it. The texture is soft and silky and the shade She's Sincere has a slight sheen to it that is barely even noticeable. If you love a blush that packs a punch then unfortunately I do not think that these, well at least the color I got, will be for you. Even if you're like me and love a more sheer buildable blush, you may love these, or you may hate them because they are very very sheer and I'm not even exaggerating when I say that. I do think that I may order one of the "darker" shades to see if the formula is the same.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush

review_content: This blush is stunning! It wears so beautifully on the skin and the staying power is incredible. It gives such a beautiful glow to the face and just compliments any makeup look. I have two of the four blushes so far. Definitely will be purchasing all.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: This is the first Patrick Ta item I have purchased and I am already a fan of his collection! The blush is fairly true to the color shown, with a bit more of a coral hue. product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Oily']

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: The shade is a bit more muted than I expected. The formula is very densely packed which makes for virtually no kickback in the pan, but it also makes it a little more difficult to pick up with a brush. Natural hair bristles might be your best bet for ease of application. I find the claim of a velvet finish to be accurate as the finish looks beautifully soft on the cheeks and never cakey.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Very subtle pigmentation, Not long lasting
review_content: I bought this because of awesome review but was rather disappointed due to too subtle of color payoff which does not last 8 hours. It applies beautifully, gives very natural subtle color on your cheeks but after 3-4 hours I don’t see the color anymore on my face. I prefer the Tarte Amazonian Clay 12-Hour Blush which applies as well as this one, lasts >9 hours, and costs $10 less.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: "Buildable" Means 10 Layers Required to See Color
review_content: Beautiful packaging and product, but takes SO much effort to layer on. I understand wanting to have a "buildable" product, but this takes minimal pigmentation to a new level. I purchased this because it was ranked well on CosDNA for not causing acne or irritation, but it is far too much work to apply. I'd rather have a product that is too pigmented than one that requires 6+ layers to even notice it on the skin.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush

review_title: Beautiful wash of color that builds nicely!
review_content:
First of all, this has slowly became one of my favorite blushes in my collection. review_content: This blush is so pretty!! I got “she’s sincere” and I have no other way to explain it but by saying it’s so pretty through and through. The packaging alone. The blush alone. This blush is one you have to build up so that’s why I gave it 4 because your girl has already hit pan.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
When these blushes initially launched, I immediately added She’s Sincere (soft peach) and She’s Adorable (golden peach) to my Loves list. After viewing and swatching the testers in store however, I ultimately decided to purchase She’s Passionate (soft pink). As previous reviewers have stated, finger swatches DO NOT do these blushes justice!! I could barely pick up any product on my fingers to get a decent swatch in store but this did not deter my purchase as I was confident that Patrick Ta would not release a subpar product. I use a tapered/pointed blush brush to slowly build up the pigmentation of this blush, or will go in directly with a slanted blush brush for a more immediate impact and then blend out the product. The blush looks so pretty both ways!! If I look very closely to my cheeks after application I can detect a very fine golden shimmer there (which is not noticeable at all in the pan), but from a normal distance the cheeks appear to have a healthy glow. As an added bonus, this blush doesn’t emphasize any texture on my cheeks and has longer staying power on my combination skin than the majority of my other blushes!! This is one of my favorite blushes for “no makeup” makeup looks and everyday wear. I already have way too many peach blushes in my collection but am tempted to add She’s Sincere to my arsenal next...
…read more

review_content: This blush you guys!!! this is the most soft blurring but beautiful pop of color I have ever put on my face! I love it with or without makeup, it complements my skin so well Patrick Ta really knew what he was doing with these I can’t wait to pick up a new color! If you’ve been eye balling it like I have! product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
At first I thought this blush didn’t have much pigment and struggled to get it to show up on my face, but I guess after 3/4 uses I must have scraped the top layer off and now it has the perfect amount of pigmentation. It is a very similar color (She’s seductive) to Charlotte Tilbury’s sex on fire blush that used to be my favorite but now this one has taken its place since the CT one is a little too pigmented and can cause issues sometimes. This one is very easy to use and build up. Love love love!!

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Oh hello sweetpea, aren't you something special :) I'm very pleased and surprised with this blush. I'm heading towards 50, so subtle-yet-there is what I need to have going on with my makeup. I wasn't sure about trying this blush, but reviews keep stating that it performs better on the face than a swatch.. and this is true. I'm a CoverFX N70, or generally a Caramel, and surprisingly this blush WORKS really well on me. I get compliments on how my skin looks so lovely today. It gives me the blush I've wanted and needed for so long, AND what I really appreciate is the fact that it's difficult to overdo it and get all clownish. I don't need pigment smacking me in the face, I need a beautiful, buildable blush, and this is it! Yay!

I love the texture of it as well- it’s so smooth and soft and buttery for a powder. I’m olive skinned and quite tan with a lot of texture from acne scarring on my cheeks, and this doesn’t catch on any blemishes like some powders can.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Its alright. I love the colors and the gorgeous packaging but it is no where near being pigmented enough for my preference. I have light to medium olive undertoned skin and this color is the darkest in the range barely showing up on my skin without a lot of extra work to get it built up. If you like more sheer blush, I would definitely try it but if you're looking for more bam like Colourpop or Becca blushes, its very sheer compared to them. Still, a great formula and packaging, just not enough punch for my preference.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
It's been about 5 years since I've used a powder blush. The last one I used was from Laura Geller, it was VERY pigmented. And after Glossier cloud paint, RMS lip to cheek, and Stila's cream blush, I'm used to a cheek color that goes on very pigmented and can be blended out to something softer. This blush is fine. It's a pretty color, the texture of the powder is nice, and it's buildable, but it doesn't have the color payoff I was expecting/hoping for. If you're into something subtle and buildable, then this is for you. I'm lazy. I want to go in with one tap and be done.

review_content: I really wanted a couple products from this line. the blushes and glosses really caught my attention. first off the packaging matches the price tag it's heavy, shiny, and beautiful quality. the product itself is great there's no powder kick up, its sheer and buildable it's just really pretty.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is not a WOW blush by any means. But that is perfectly fine for me! It looks gorgeous on the skin, doesn't emphasize texture and lasts great on me ( I do always use a matte setting spray). It gives me a pretty wash off matte color without being overly bold or shimmery or extra. Its a great part of a base when you're taking the focus to the eyes. I also enjoy this on a more natural makeup day. My personal taste means I don't want BLUSH, i just want a healthy, pretty base. If you like a shimmery, bright blush this isn't for you.

product_name: PATRICK TA Monochrome Moment - Velvet Blush
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I’ll be honest, I walked right past the Patrick Ta display every time I went into Sephora... finally after reading some reviews as well as watching the Wayne Goss review, I gave in and bought one in She’s Sincere. I have light-medium skin and I’m not a fan of bright blush. I love the Tarte blushes because of the staying power but even their nude blushes are still a little too pigmented for my liking. This blush however is my holy grail and makes me WANT to use blush! It applies beautifully with a brush and it’s buildable to your liking! It’s super user friendly! The finish is beautiful too... it like melts into your skin! I ended up ordering two more colors online! This is a fantastic blush and I see myself using this for the long run!

review_content:
I LOVE the color of this blush. It’s a beautiful soft pink and really compliments my light skin tone. However, the color payoff isn’t the best I’ve used (you really have to dig in it to get the product onto the brush) and it doesn’t seem to stay. After a couple of hours it seems to disappear. I’ve tried different primers, foundations, and setting spray but I just can’t get it to last! I’m going to keep trying it because the color is so beautiful and the packaging is nice, but I’m not totally sold.

review_content:
I feel like I’m the only one of this planet that didn’t like this blush/blush formula. Don’t get me wrong, I LOVE a buildable blush. But this one I literally have to scratch my brush into it to get the most minimal payoff. The formula is DRY and tbh it looks really dry on the face as well. I was also disappointed in the shade she’s seductive which was supposed to be a mauve plum. It just looked like any other coral blush on the face. The packaging is beautiful but I’m really disappointed in the product itself.

review_content: I got she’s sincere and she’s seductive. I’ve been into nude colors lately and these are so pretty. Been using it like Patrick recommends as an all over monochrome on my cheeks and eyes. Love it! Go Ta!
